thread.title: 5,000 in mass ‘yee sang’ tossing session
thread.title_full: 5,000 in mass ‘yee sang’ tossing session - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: 5,000 in mass ‘yee sang’ tossing session
text:
BUTTERWORTH: Some 5,000 devotees and visitors took part in a mass yee sang tossing session on the seventh day of the Chinese New Year, which is also the birthday of mankind.
The traditional dish, made up of 15 ingredients such as carrot, white radish, ginger, roasted peanuts and sesame paste, was served along a 209.7m-long line at the Tow Boo Kong Temple in Jalan Raja Uda on Friday night.
Shouts of heng, ong and huat (fortune, luck and wealth in Hokkien) were heard as everyone tossed the colourful yee sang at 10pm, hoping for a good year ahead.
A dazzling fireworks display also brightened the sky for about three minutes.
Organising committee chairman Ang Lim Kean said the temple committee had been organising the event since 2012.
